alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 11:56AM MDT until June 13 at 5:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pueblo CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek Near Fountain affecting El Paso County. .Thunderstorms have been producing heavy rainfalls, which have caused excessive runoff of area creeks into Fountain Creek. Swift moving water and stream bank erosion are notable hazards. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain, Pinon, Pueblo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek Near Fountain. * WHEN...From this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor agricultural flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 12.4 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 04/30/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM MDT.
